intro: Ouratea schoenleiniana, commonly known as the white-flowered ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its dense, glossy foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has a compact, rounded shape. Its leaves are elliptical with a smooth margin and a slightly waxy texture. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to ornamental gardens.
